document.docTitle: Trombidium barooghi Saboori & Irani-Nejad, 2007, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Trombidium (Acari: Trombidiidae) from East Azarbaijan province, Iran

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Trombidium (Acari: Trombidiidae) from East Azarbaijan province, Iran

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Larva with the following features: fD = ( 2 ) 4-6 - 4 - 4 - 4 = 22 (+ 2 ); fV = 4 - 2 u = 6 ; fcx = 2 - 2 - 1 ; fnTr = 1 - 1 - 1 ; fnFe = 5 - 4 - 4 ; fnGe = 4 - 3 - 3 ; fnTi = 5 - 5 - 5 ; fnTa = 15 - 14 - 13 ; fSol = I ( 0-2 - 2 - 1 ), II ( 0-1 - 2 - 1 ), III ( 0-1 -0- 0); fκ = I ( 1 - 1 ), II ( 1 -0), III (0-0); fζ = 2 -0-0; fε = 1 - 1 -0; fPp = 0-N-0-NNN 2-5 Nω;IP = 704 ; tarsus III with a short and thick inner claw; AP <MA; AA <SB.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Metric data of
Trombidium barooghi
sp. nov.
larvae.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype larva
: Idiosoma oval, dorsal surface with a scutum, a scutellum and 22 dorsal setae, each arising from small sclerite except c 1 and h 1 (
Fig. 1
). Scutum rounded anteriorly and with rounded posterolateral angles; large, covering most of prodorsum; bearing three pairs of setae (AM, AL and PL) and one pair of trichobothria (S); punctated in most part but striated in parts anterior and slightly posterior to AM setae. AM filiform. There is a small chitinous bar (tear like) behind AM. AL and PL both thicker than AM and barbed. AL setae situated closer to PL than AM. S filiform and smooth. A large oval scutellum posterior to scutum and wider than long, with punctations and two barbed setae. Ocular sclerite, 27 long and 12 wide, situated lateral to postero-lateral angles of scutum; with 2 eyes, anterior 10 , posterior 8 in diameter. All dorsal setae with distinct barbs.

Ventral surface of idiosoma with one pair of intercoxal setae (
3 a
), 3 pairs of ventral setae located on sclerites slightly smaller than those of dorsal setae, and an anus (
Fig. 2
). All setae on ventral idiosoma with distinct barbs. Coxal fields punctate. A minute supracoxal seta present on anterolateral corners of dorsal coxae I. Coxa I with proximal seta
1 a
, filiform and antero-distal seta
1 b
, barbed. Coxa II with antero-distal seta
2 b
, and antero-median seta
2 a
; both barbed. Coxa III with single antero-median seta
3 b
, barbed (
Fig. 2
). One pair of intercoxal setae
3 a
between coxae III. NDV = 22 ( 2 ) + 6 = 28 ( 2 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–2.
Trombidium barooghi
sp. nov.
(larva), 1, dorsal view of idiosoma; 2, ventral view of gnathosoma and idiosoma.

FIGURES 3–5.
Trombidium barooghi
sp. nov.
(larva), 3 , Leg II, femur-tarsus; 4 , Leg I, femur-tarsus; 5. Leg III, femurtarsus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Trombidium (Teresothrombium) barooghi
belongs to the species group of this subgenus having normal AL and normal setae on scutellum and thick and brush-like subcapitular setae. Three species have this feature:
T. hyperi Vercammen-Grandjean et al. , 1977
,
T. mastigotarsum Feider, 1956
and
T. southcotti Zhang & Saboori, 1996
. It differs from
T. hyperi
by shorter AW ( 92–97 vs. 104–109 ), PW ( 92–97 vs. 108–114 ), SD ( 87–92 vs. 116–128 ), AM ( 30–37 vs. 43–46 ), LSS ( 99–111 vs. 117–128 ), leg I ( 241–245 vs. 292–297 ), leg II ( 220–232 vs. 278–288 ), leg III ( 219–227 vs. 273–280 ) and IP ( 680–704 vs. 845–865 ); from
T. mastigotarsum
by number of setae on Fe I–III ( 5 - 4 - 4 vs. 4 - 3 - 3 ), Ge I-III ( 4 - 3 - 3 vs. 5 - 3-4 ), shorter W ( 104–111 vs. 162 ), HS ( 50 vs. 65 ), longer SD ( 87–92 vs. 61 ) and from
T. southcotti
by shorter SD ( 87–92 vs. 120–126 ), AM ( 30–37 vs. 45–63 ), W ( 104–111 vs. 120–130 ), LSS ( 109–111 vs. 132–145 ).

Etymology. The species is named in honour of Dr. Hassan Barooghi (professor of entomology) for his great efforts in developing entomology in Iran and exchanging entomological informations among Iranian entomologists.

Types .
The holotype (ARS-
20061111
- 1 a) and paratype (ARS-
20061111
- 1 b) larvae were collected by K. Haddad Irani-nejad,
15 May 2005
, free-living on soil, in Tickmadash, Mianeh city, East Azarbaijan province, Iran . The holotype and paratype are deposited in the Acarological Collection, Zoological Museum, College of Agriculture, University of Tehran, Karaj, Iran .
